label: chronic mountain sickness
definition: A pathological condition resulting from chronic exposure to hypoxia at high altitude. The syndrome is characterized by an excessive number of red blood cells associated with a high blood hemoglobin concentration ([Hb]), hypoxemia, and, in some cases, pulmonary hypertension. Clinical signs include headache, fatigue, sleep disturbances, dyspnea, digestive complaints, and high risk of thrombotic events.

label: Asperger syndrome, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing Asperger sydrome.

label: disorder of peptide and amine metabolism
definition: An inherited metabolic disease that has its basis in the disruption of peptide and/or amine metabolic process.

label: disorder of methylamine metabolism
definition: An inherited metabolic disease that has its basis in the disruption of methylamine metabolic process.

label: brain malformations with or without urinary tract defects
definition: A brain disorder caused by pathogenic variants in NFIA that is characterized by developmental delay, corpus callosum agenesis/hypoplasia and craniofacial dysmorphism, such as macrocephaly (caused by hydrocephalus or ventriculomegaly), low-set ears, anteverted nostrils and micrognathia. Urinary tract defects (e.g. vesicoureteral reflux, urinary incontinence) are also frequently associated. Other reported variable manifestations include hypotonia, tethered spinal cord, Chiari type I malformation and seizures.

label: IFT140-related recessive ciliopathy
definition: Any ciliopathy in which the cause of the disease is biallelic variants in the IFT140 gene.

label: spondyloepimetaphyseal dysplasia
definition: An osteochondrodysplasia that results in abnormalities of bone growth in the vertebral column, epiphysis, and metaphysis.

label: familial ovarian carcinoma
definition: Ovarian carcinoma that has developed in relatives of patients that have a history of ovarian carcinoma.

label: mirror movements 1 and/or agenesis of the corpus callosum
definition: A familial congenital mirror movement disorder where individuals with heterozygous variants in DCC have congenital mirror movements and/or agenesis of the corpus callosum (not with or without- some individuals do not demonstrate mirror movements and only have corpus callosum defects, even within the same family).

label: complex neurodevelopmental disorder with motor features
definition: A complex neurodevelopmental disorder that involves more than one phenotype associated with the central nervous system, including but not limited to intellectual disability, autism, and seizures (epilepsy). Additionally, the disorder features at least one phenotype associated with motor function, including but not limited to spasticity, hypo- or hypertonia, dyskinesia, choreo-athetosis, or ataxia.

label: difference of sexual differentiation, non-human animal
skin disease caused by bacterial infection, non-human animal
COACH syndrome 1
definition: Any COACH syndrome in which the cause of the disease is a variation in the TMEM67 gene.

label: primary immunodeficiency due to calcium channel deficiency
definition: An immunodeficiency disease caused by a variation in the CRACR2A gene.

label: congenital emphysematous lung disease due to Filamin A loss-of-function variant
definition: Any interstitial lung disease specific to childhood caused by a loss-of-function variation in the FLNA gene. Female children are reported more often. Rare male patients with loss-of-function FLNA mutation-associated lung disease with residual protein function can survive into infancy with a severe form of the phenotype.

label: non-severe combined immunodeficiency due to COPG1 deficiency
definition: Any non-severe combined immunodeficiency caused by a deficiency in the COPG1 gene.

label: early-onset pulmonary and cutaneous vasculitis
definition: A monogenic autoinflammatory disorder caused by a de novo activating mutation, p.Tyr515∗, in hematopoietic cell kinase (HCK). The disease is characterized by cutaneous vasculitis and chronic pulmonary inflammation that progresses to fibrosis.

label: multisystem autoimmune disease due to IKAROS gain of function
definition: An autoimmune disease caused by a loss-of-function variation in the IKZF1/IKAROSgene. Leukocytes of patients exhibited specific defects including impaired IL-2 production by T cells, T helper (TH) skewing toward TH2, low numbers of regulatory T cells (Treg), eosinophilia, and abnormal PC proliferation.

label: HELIOS deficiency
definition: A non-severe combined immunodeficiency caused by a loss-of-function variation in the IKZF2 gene that is characterized by recurrent upper respiratory infections, thrush and mucosal ulcers, and chronic lymphadenopathy.

label: ITPKB deficiency
definition: Any non-severe combined immunodeficiency in which the cause of the disease is variation in the ITPKB gene.

label: MAN2B2 deficiency
definition: Any non-severe combined immunodeficiency in which the cause of the disease is variation in the MAN2B2 gene.

label: chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis and connective tissue disease due to JNK1 haploinsufficiency
definition: An immunodeficiency disease caused by a variation in MAPK8, the gene encoding c-Jun N-terminal kinase 1 (JNK1), that is characterized by chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis and a connective tissue disorder that clinically overlaps with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (EDS).

label: cytomegalovirus pneumonia due to NOS2 deficiency
definition: Cytomegalovirus pneumonia due to variant in the NOS2 gene.

label: autoimmune pulmonary disease due to PD-1 deficiency
definition: An autoimmune disease that is characterized by a lack of PD-1 on patient peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) and reduced IFN production in response to mycobacterial stimuli.

label: non-severe combined immunodeficiency due to polymerase delta deficiency
definition: Any non-severe combined immunodeficiency in which the cause of the disease is variation in the POLD1/POLD2 gene.

label: agammaglobulinemia, autosomal recessive, due to BOB1 deficiency
definition: Any agammaglobulinemia in which the cause of the disease is autosomal recessive deficiency in the BOB1 gene.

label: hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis due to RhoG deficiency
definition: Any genetic hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis in which the cause of the disease is an autosomal recessive variation in the RHOG gene.

label: autoinflammatory syndrome due to TBK1 deficiency
definition: Any autoinflammatory syndrome in which the cause of the disease is an autosomal recessive variation in the TBK1 gene.

label: immunodeficiency, common variable, due to APRIL deficiency
definition: Any commonn variable immunodeficiency in which the cause of the disease is an autosomal recessive variation in the TNFS13 gene.

label: disorder of galactose and fructose metabolism
definition: An inherited disorder of carbohydrate metabolism that is has its basis in the disruption of galactose and/or fructose metabolic process.

label: urea cycle disorder or inherited hyperammonemia
definition: A disorder of amino acid metabolism that has its basis in the disruption of the urea cycle or an inherited hyperammonemia (any specific disease which causes an inherited increased concentration of ammonia in the blood).

label: inborn disorder of the metabolism of sulfur-containing amino acids and hydrogen sulfide
definition: A disorder of amino acid metabolism that has its basis in the disruption of the metabolism of sulfur-containing amino acids and/or hydrogen sulfide.

label: inborn disorder of glycine and serine metabolism
definition: A disorder of amino acid metabolism that has its basis in the disruption of the metabolism of glycine and/or serine.

label: inborn disorder of ornithine, proline and hydroxyproline metabolism
definition: A disorder of amino acid metabolism that has its basis in the disruption of the metabolism of ornithine, proline and/or hydroxyproline.

label: inborn disorder of lysine, hydroxylysine, and tryptophan metabolism
definition: A disorder of amino acid metabolism that has its basis in the disruption of the metabolism of lysine, hydroxylysine, and/or tryptophan.

label: inborn disorder of glutamate/glutamine and aspartate/asparagine metabolism
definition: A disorder of amino acid metabolism that has its basis in the disruption of the metabolism of glutamate/glutamine and aspartate/asparagine.

label: disorder of polyamine metabolism
definition: An inherited metabolic disease that has its basis in the disruption of the polyamine metabolic process.

label: choroidal neovascularization
definition: An eye disorder described by the growth of new blood vessels that originate from the choroid through a break in the Bruch membrane into the sub–retinal pigment epithelium (sub-RPE) or subretinal space. Choroidal neovascularization (CNV) is a major cause of visual loss.
